array.string: Hello!
I wasn't sleeping I promise...
Today we are going to look at some sorting algorithms.
You may not know it, but sorting algorithms are used all the time in computers and are really important.
Imagine you want to list all your songs by song name.
The songs need to be sorted!
There are many ways we can go about sorting such a list.
The set of rules we follow to complete a task like sorting is called an ALGORITHM.
Some really smart people have already done the hard work and figured out some sorting algorithms for us.
Some sorting algorithms are much better than others though...
The quality of a sorting algorithm is usually measured by the NUMBER OF COMPARISONS the algorithm does.
Let's check some of them out by sorting some of my emoji friends!
This is a slow but simple sorting algorithm.
It scans through the list again and again...
...each time pushing the biggest element to the top.
It has to do lots of comparisons in order to figure this out though.
It's only practical for long lists if the list is very nearly sorted already.
